lead_paragraph: “The Moment of Truth,” Fox’s new game show in which contestants are asked provocative questions after having been hooked up to a lie detector, passed its own first test with flying colors, drawing particularly impressive ratings in its debut on Wednesday at 9 p.m. According to Nielsen’s estimates, the show delivered 23.2 million viewers, more than any series premiere on any network in nearly a year. The last new show to earn higher ratings was Fox’s “Are You Smarter Than a Fifth Grader?” which drew 26.5 million viewers last February.

headline.main: ‘Moment of Truth:’ More Proof That We Like to See People Squirm
